text: There is a great discovery still to be made in literature, that of paying literary men by the quantity they do not write.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: To reform a world, to reform a nation, no wise man will undertake and all but foolish men know, that the only solid, though a far slower reformation, is what each begins and perfects on himself.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: No sadder proof can be given by a man of his own littleness than disbelief in great men.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: As long as men are free to ask what they must, free to say what they think, free to think what they will, freedom can never be lost and science can never regress.
author: Marcel Proust

text: My weaknesses have always been food and men - in that order.
author: Dolly Parton
